subject: Modification to the Guidelines and Procedure for engagement of External Professionals (EPs) and Young Professionals (YPs) for engagement of Eminent External Professionals (EEP) in NHAI -reg.
text: HRd <c4 RTHf qifearot (Tsv 9dat & THPf F4, 4Ra TAR) National Highways Authority of India (Ministry of Road Transport and Highways, Government of India) 374 *R 4-5 & 6, 74er-10, ERGT, # @orif 110 0750 G-5 & 6. Sector-10, Dwarka New Delhi-110075 394/Phone 91-11-25074100 / 25074200 NHAII Guidelines/ Administration/ 2025 Circular No:1.3.1.43/2025 dated O8th July, 2025 {Decision taken on E-Office File No. 11014/8/2025-0/0 GM(HR/Admin-I) (Comp. No. 280801)} Sub: Modification to the Guidelines and Procedure for engagement of External Professionals   (EPs) and  Young Professionals (YPs) for   engagement of Eminent External Professionals (EEP) in NHAI -reg: Consequent upon approval of the Authority in its 160th Meeting held on 16.04.2024; Publication of the National Highways Authority of India (Recruitment, Seniority and Promotion) Regulations, 2024 in the Gazette of India (Extraordinary) , Part-IIl, Section 4 on 30.12.2024, wherein the following has been prescribed: Clause 3(n) Definition: - "Professionals" means the External Professional or Eminent External Professionals (EEP) or the Young Professional engaged on Contract basis for a specified tenure and for specific work who shall not be treated as an Employee of the Authority; (ii) Clause 21 Engagement of Advisers or Consultants: - The Authority may engage from time to time any Person as Adviser or Consultant as it may consider necessary on such Terms and Conditions as laid down in the Guidelines and procedures for engaging External Professionals (EP) , Eminent External Professionals (EEP) and Young Professionals (YP) in National Highways Authority of India approved by the Authority as amended from time to time: Provided that the Adviser or Consultant shall not be treated as Employee of the Authority but shall be treated as Professional. 2. The Authority also has approved modifications as indicated in the Appendix to the clauses 3.1, 3,2, 5.1, 8 and 9.1 of the Guidelines and Procedure for engagement of External Professionals (EPs) and Young Professionals (YPs) issued vide   Policy Circular No.1.3.1.12/2017 dated 21.06.2017(Copy Enclosed) (as amended from time to time) for engagement of Eminent External Professionals (EEP) in NHAI: Further the Terms and Conditions of Contractual engagement of EEPs along with composition of the Screening Committee and Selection Committee are enclosed herewith as Annexure-VII; which will form Part of the ibid Guidelines and Procedure for engagement of External Professionals (EPs) and Young Professionals (YPs) {as amended from time to time}: In addition, the composition of the Remuneration Committee (RC) has also been prescribed in Annexure-VIl as approved by the Competent Authority to decide the remuneration of EEPs. 3. This issue with the approval of Competent Authority. Encl:: As stated above. (CS. Sanjay Kumar Patel) Ic Chief General Manager (Coord.)
